author: Dana Goldstein
description: The Trump administration had asked states to certify that their schools did not practice “illegal D.E.I.” and threatened to cut off billions of dollars from schools that did not comply.
title: Judge Blocks White House Effort to Defund Schools With D.E.I. Programs

author: Benjamin Mullin
description: The nonprofit will receive less revenue from its members, which are under pressure to make up for shortfalls of their own.
title: PBS Slashes Budget by 21% After Federal Funding Cuts

author: Mitch Smith and Ernesto Londoño
description: State prosecutors had previously charged the man with second-degree murder in the deaths of State Representative Melissa Hortman and her husband.
title: Minnesota Assassination Suspect Indicted on First-Degree Murder Charges

author: J. David Goodman
description: The leader of Democrats in the Texas House said the battle over redistricting, which could determine control of Congress, is likely to continue in the courts.
title: Texas Democrats Will Return Home, Allowing Vote on Congressional Map

author: Matthew Cullen
description: Also, an experimental treatment for chronic pain showed promise. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.
title: Trump Sought to Minimize Expectations for Putin Talks

author: Emma G. Fitzsimmons
description: The City Council is likely to override most of Mayor Eric Adams’s recent vetoes. Still, the mayor seems eager for a fight over bills affecting grocery delivery workers and street vendors.
title: Eric Adams Vetoes Bill to Raise Wages for Instacart Workers

author: David Brooks
description: To be one nation, we have to embrace ground-up social change.
title: America’s New Segregation

author: Tyler Pager and Devlin Barrett
description: The Trump administration has taken steps that have hobbled Washington’s efforts to reduce crime, such as gutting its U.S. attorney’s office and enacting budget cuts of more than $1 billion.
title: As Trump Seizes D.C.’s Police, Critics Say He’s Undercut Its Ability to Fight Crime

author: Laurel Rosenhall, Jesus Jiménez and Hamed Aleaziz
description: The armed and masked agents assembled outside the museum where the governor was speaking. Mayor Karen Bass of Los Angeles called it “a provocative act.”
title: Newsom Held an Event in L.A. Federal Immigration Agents Showed Up Outside.

author: Dana Rubinstein and Anna Kodé
description: As he runs a long-shot third-party bid for re-election, Mayor Eric Adams is proposing an aggressive approach, favored by conservatives, of combating open drug use.
title: Adams Pushes to Force Drug Users Off NYC Streets

author: Adeel Hassan
description: The document describes payments made for expedition supplies, and was signed by Hernán Cortés, who conquered the Aztecs.
title: A 500-Year-Old Receipt for Supplies to Conquer an Empire Is Returned to Mexico

author: Mihir Zaveri
description: Former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s proposal is a dig at Zohran Mamdani, his main opponent in the mayor’s race, but it could upend the housing search for middle-income New Yorkers.
title: With ‘Zohran’s Law,’ Cuomo Wants to Limit Who Can Live in Rent-Stabilized Homes. How Would That Work?

author: Jill Cowan and Orlando Mayorquín
description: Officials and volunteers patrolled areas around schools, part of an effort to warn families about potential raids and reassure them that their children were safe at school.
title: In L.A., Fear of ICE Raids Put the First Day of School On Edge

author: David French
description: Trump isn’t just shaping the nation; he’s also changing the evangelical church.
title: This Evangelical Pastor Wants to Replace Women’s Right to Vote

author: Adam Liptak and Zach Montague
description: A trade group representing sites like Facebook and X said the law ran afoul of the First Amendment.
title: Supreme Court Allows Mississippi Law on Children’s Use of Social Media, for Now

author: Karoun Demirjian
description: Chief Pamela A. Smith’s order effectively serves as a carve-out to how the department enforces a broader ban that prohibits the local police from cooperating with federal immigration enforcement.
title: D.C. Police Move to Share Limited Information With Federal Immigration Officials

author: Mihir Zaveri
description: The plan would open a swath of Manhattan, including the garment district, to residential development.
title: Plan to Add 9,500 Homes to Midtown Expected to Get City Council Approval

author: Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs
description: Federal agents are assisting the local police, but a surge in National Guard troops hasn’t hit the streets.
title: Troops in Washington Remain Largely Unseen So Far

author: Linda Qiu and Jamie Leventhal
description: In the face of mounting discontent over his administration’s handling of the Jeffrey Epstein files, President Trump has turned to deflection, denial and downplaying.
title: Fact-Checking Trump’s Epstein Defenses

author: Jonathan Wolfe
description: The order comes after a series of legal setbacks for the families of Sandy Hook victims as they tried to collect money owed to them by the conspiracy theorist Alex Jones.
title: Judge Orders Liquidation of Infowars to Pay Sandy Hook Families

author: Rebecca Robbins
description: Manufacturing in Ireland has long helped many American drug companies pay lower taxes. But that strategy was designed for a world without President Trump’s tariffs.
title: Trump’s Tariffs Set to Hit Ireland, Where Drugmakers Play Tax Games

author: Patricia Mazzei
description: The state says it will run the new center from an empty prison that could hold 2,000 federal detainees. This one will be called “Deportation Depot.”
title: Florida to Open Second Immigrant Detention Center Called ‘Deportation Depot’

author: Carl Zimmer
description: In a recent study, scientists successfully decoded not only the words people tried to say but the words they merely imagined saying.
title: For Some Patients, the ‘Inner Voice’ May Soon Be Audible

author: Andrew Duehren and Maggie Haberman
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent sought total control over the I.R.S., an agency where Mr. Long, the new commissioner, had started to put his own mark on the job.
title: The Auctioneer and the Treasury Chief: How Billy Long Fell Short at the I.R.S.

author: Ali Watkins
description: Nicholas Rossi lived for years as a fugitive before being extradited. A jury in Utah found him guilty of a 2008 sexual assault.
title: Man Who Faked His Death and Fled to Scotland Is Convicted of Rape

author: Jon Caramanica
description: The two megastars recently sat for hourslong video conversations on streaming platforms, but took different approaches to what they revealed.
title: Taylor Swift and Drake Promote Albums on Podcasts in Media Landscape Shift

author: Jess Bidgood and David E. Sanger
description: President Trump wants to be seen as a peacemaker, but the meeting comes with enormous stakes.
title: Why Does Trump Want to Meet With Putin, and What Are the Risks?

author: Jessica Testa
description: For stars promoting their projects, podcasts have become an appealing alternative to late-night TV and glossy magazines.
title: Even Taylor Swift Can’t Resist Podcasts, the Celebrity Safe Space

author: Brittany Loggins
description: The end of “And Just Like That …” means the end of a real estate portfolio that includes a cozy Upper East Side studio and a grand Gramercy townhouse.
title: Revisiting Carrie Bradshaw’s Apartments in ‘Sex and the City’ and ‘And Just Like That’

author: Rob Copeland
description: We explain the benefits and the risks.
title: How Cryptocurrency Could Be Coming for Your Bank Account

author: Patrick Kingsley, Fatima AbdulKarim and Natan Odenheimer
description: Extremists are carrying out one of the most violent campaigns against Palestinian villages since the U.N. began keeping records.
title: Israeli Settlers Unleash Record High Attacks in West Bank

author: Tracy Mumford, Will Jarvis, Ian Stewart, Jessica Metzger and Constant Méheut
description: Plus, a C.I.A. secret up for auction.
title: Russia Steps Up Its Battlefield Attacks, and America’s Drinking Drops to Record Low

author: The Editorial Board
description: Reflections on social cohesion and law enforcement can help policymakers reduce crime even further.
title: Crime Keeps Falling. Here’s Why.

author: Jack Healy, Julia O’Malley, Emily Schwing and Ash Adams
description: Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelensky, was not invited to the Trump-Putin summit in Anchorage, but 1,000 Ukrainian refugees in Alaska will be watching with trepidation.
title: Alaska’s Ukrainian Refugees Brace for Putin’s Arrival in Their Safe Harbor

author: Emily Badger and Amy Fan
description: The president and his allies have berated local officials. Yet the federal government has often made it harder for those officials to manage the capital.
title: Trump Wants to ‘Take Back’ D.C., but the Federal Government Already Controls Much of It

author: Colby Smith
description: The Federal Reserve is poised to lower interest rates in September. But signs of stickier inflation could limit how much relief officials can ultimately provide to borrowers.
title: Fed Faces High Bar for Big Cuts Despite White House Pressure

author: Pam Belluck
description: A guitarist in a death metal band was one of several people who found that personalized deep brain stimulation eased their pain and helped them reduce pain medication.
title: Treating Chronic Pain is Hard. An Experimental Approach Shows Promise.

author: Ross Douthat, Sophia Alvarez Boyd and Raina Raskin
description: Why the left can’t win until it reckons with this question.
title: Is Trump a Test or Triumph for Democracy?

author: Kim Severson
description: Processed-food giants and produce growers are tweaking products and ads to reach the Make America Healthy Again movement. But the strategy carries risks.
title: There’s Money to Be Made in ‘MAHA.’ Food Companies Want In.

author: Brian Josephs
description: We’ve been envisioning how some of today’s biggest dilemmas could transform the city. We’d like you to imagine with us.
title: What Do You Want to See in New York’s Future?

author: Gia Kourlas
description: It can feel overwhelming to watch a dance. But if you follow the hands, they can unlock the mysteries of a moving body.
title: The Secret Weapon of Dance? Hands!

author: Thomas Gibbons-Neff
description: Thunder Ranch is one of the best-known shooting schools in American gun culture, offering firearms as a way to change your life when all else fails.
title: He Was Lost. Could a Shooting Range Like Thunder Ranch Help Him Find Himself?

author: Ivan Penn and Karen Weise
description: Electricity rates for individuals and small businesses could rise sharply as Amazon, Google, Microsoft and other technology companies build data centers and expand into the energy business.
title: Big Tech’s A.I. Boom Is Reordering the U.S. Power Grid

author: Eliza Shapiro
description: Andrew Cuomo is basing his new line of attack against Zohran Mamdani on a certain definition of wealth. But the reality is complicated.
title: Does Earning $142,000 in New York City Make You Rich?

author: Grace Ashford
description: Gov. Kathy Hochul, who withheld an endorsement in the New York City Democratic primary, has yet to endorse the winner, Zohran Mamdani.
title: Will New York’s Governor Endorse Mamdani for Mayor?

author: Trish Bendix
description: Nicole Byer said she supports Trump hosting this year's Kennedy Center Honors: “Anything that distracts him from running this country into the ground.”
title: Late Night Hopes Trump’s New Hosting Gig Will Keep Him Busy

author: John Schwartz and Jonathan Corum
description: Sleuths have solved three of the panels of the Kryptos sculpture at the agency’s headquarters. Now the artwork’s creator is announcing the sale of the solution to the fourth.
title: You Can Buy One of the C.I.A.’s Greatest Mysteries at an Auction House

author: Lydia DePillis and Jin Yu Young
description: The president’s hostility toward foreign students has made American higher education a riskier proposition for them. Other countries are eager to capitalize.
title: As Trump Pushes International Students Away, Asian Schools Scoop Them Up

author: Michael S. Schmidt and Maggie Haberman
description: Boris Epshteyn, a personal lawyer for President Trump, connected two firms — Kirkland & Ellis and Skadden Arps — to the Commerce Department.
title: Law Firms That Settled With Trump Are Pressed to Help on Trade Deals

author: Hannah Ziegler
description: The unsightly bunnies are infected with cottontail rabbit papillomavirus, which can cause growths that resemble warts or tentacles.
title: Rabbits With Hornlike Growths Are Hopping Around Colorado. Are They OK?

author: Chris Cameron
description: President Trump is the first president to use a declared emergency to wrest control of Washington, D.C.’s police force.
title: Trump’s D.C. Police Takeover and National Guard Deployment: What to Know

author: Clay Risen
description: His summer conferences gave budding playwrights a chance to try out new works, many of which went on to success in New York.
title: George C. White, Founder of Eugene O’Neill Theater Center, Dies at 89
